Package seprhou.gui

The gaphical code of the game.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractScreen
    Implementation of the Screen interface which sets up classes common to all screens
    Assets
    Class which stores references to game assets
    AtcGame
    The main class of the game
    ConcreteAircraft
    The only type of aircraft (currently?) available
    Constants
    Class containing the game constants
    ControlPanel
    The actor which displays the control panel on the right of the game screen
    GameArea
    Class which manages the entire game area
    GameOverScreen
    The screen displayed after the game is over
    GameScreen
    The main game screen
    HighScoresScreen
    Empty class which could be used to show the high scores
    Main
    The initial class which starts libGDX using the lwjgl backend
    MenuScreen
    The screen displaying the main menu
    OptionsScreen
    Empty class which could be used to show the options screen

Package seprhou.gui Description

The gaphical code of the game.

This package contains all the GUI and user interaction stuff. You should probably read up on libGDX and the scene2d part of libGDX to know how everything works here. The classes are layed out in a hierarchy roughly as follows.

Main and AtcGame

The Main class controls the game startup and the AtcGame class acts as the top of the game hierarchy. However all this class does is pass on events to be handled by the current screen.

AbstractScreen

The AbstractScreen class manages components common to each screen, the most important being the libGDX Stage. All the events are passed to the stage and are then distributed to whichever objects asked to receive them (like the individual labels or even the whole game area).

Screen implementations

The Screen implementations (MenuScreen, GameScreen, GameOverScreen, OptionsScreen and HighScoresScreen) managed their individual screens and the components on them. Most use libGDX scene2d objects to draw labels and buttons on the screen. The only exception is GameArea.

GameArea

Finally the GameArea class handles and renders the game itself.
